content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice contribution, I like it. It can be done quickly with regex or just string manipulation. Good tests and validators with meaningful names üëç

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: C'est un bon exercice pour le clash !
I think is a good exercice for clash

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice creative clash, with cases that cover the different dimensions (oh sh*t, words can go over spaces. Oh sh*t, they can go over punctuation as well. Oh sh*t, they can overlap). I should probably learn regular expressions to get fastest with this one.

Pff this one was challenging due to the fact that I do not know regular expressions too well so I did it without. Assuming that most coders should know about regular expressions this clash should be doable.

I did at some point have code that did not pass the 'Overlapping matches' test & validator, and it also not passed the 'Big one' validator BUT it passed the 'Big one' test. That means there is imbalance between your Big one test and validator (I assume because in the validator there is an overlap issue, while that is not in the test). I suggest you to change the 'Big one' test to add also one overlap case in there - it makes sense that if a player fails the 'Overlapping matches', he/she should also fail the final test.

Goal
* Please add "is" before "interrupted".

* Suggest to change the last sentence as:
Any non-matching parts of the sentence must be kept unchanged.

Constraints
* Please change "characters" to "total number of characters".

* Please change "words" to "number of words".

* What is [[n]]? Is it referring to "number of words"?

* Suggest to change "characters in sentence" to "length of sentence".

Thanks.
Added, changed, fixed, amended, deleted, and replaced.

I originally intended Big One to just be a test of scale, but you're right, it should use all the lessons learned in earlier tests. I'll get on it.

(EDIT) Added overlapping matches to the Big One test case.

Essential resources for learning regular expressions:
https://regexr.com
https://regexcrossword.com
